title: Wild readings after upgrading Galaxy S6 to Android 5.1.1
comment: Used this app for 2 years without issue. After Android reflash and upgrade to 5.1.1 am getting wild results when logging that seem to have the GPS fixes jumping all over the place, e.g.  Aberdeen Scotland one minute and London 30 secs later, a difference of over 600km. Never  had this before. As a registered blind person I use this to log my train journeys and track them on Google using my PC later. Any help to fix what was a really enjoyable experience is much appreciated. Thanks.

title: simple but great!
comment: lightweight, simple and does not stop in the bakground, perfetto!
Awesome app. Love it that the app can automatically start on startup, my old phone reboots often so I lose only a few minutes while my phone reboots :)
Good
Working much better now

I have the latest but it crashes my phone randomly. Seems the new file date creation dont happen on midnight Autoupload dosent start automatically when coming to net but have to wait the next interval Phone being connected to charger should disable some timeouts about battery draining. And maybe option to log and upload all the time to see the LIVE VIEW.
Did not record speed.. sorry
No frills and 100% meet the purpose

title: Used it on my trip
comment: Totally going to story map because of it
Great app

title: Most reliable tracker
comment: This is, by far, the best gps tracker I've used. I tried many different trackers, and some of them were ok, but this is the only one that I can count on to run all the time in the background without fail.

title: Great battery friendly hiking companion
comment: While hiking in Colorado I use this every week for two main purposes: minimal battery usage GPS logging to add location meta data to to my DSLR photos later and to quickly check our elevation. Absolutely love this app. Thank you very much for such a wonderful and battery saving tool.

title: Runs all day without touching the battery
comment: Truly remarkable app, and has worked flawlessly for several weeks now. Great for vacations and gps tagging photos and hikes.

title: GPS Logger
comment: Simple, works well.

But 2 possible improvements though:  A- for custom names, translate MONTH% with '06' (for June) instead of '6', the first of the month with '01', etc.  B- for the recording interval, request a fast and a slow threshold. The application will decide the recording frequency according to the range of movement between the last traces.    Update : need a fix : it seems it conflicts with "waze" app :-(  Sincerely.

title: Simple
comment: Simple & effective gps logger

title: No file created
comment: Installed this app and tried logging data. When I got home could find no data recorded. There was no GPSLogger folder. The front screen mentions a path of /storage/sdcard0/Android/data/com.mendhak.gpslogger/files but this does not exist either. I am stumped.

title: The best
comment: Doesn't run down phone battery.  Always reliable.  Provides all the features I need.

title: Prefect gps, weird sharing
comment: Maybe it's android lacking the right activities, but this can't use the same apps you get for "sharing". Can only choose some hard coded stuff like drop box or Google docs.

title: Great lighyweight gps logger
comment: Excellent logger that is packed with gps logging options but operates in a lightweight approach with options to configure level of detail required and where to log to.

title: used to work excellent @ 5star with great accuracy, now lucky to be 2star
comment: unfortunately later releases (esp current v60) is terrible regarding consistent logging, accurate logging etc. same hardware, same os, same everything except the app, i use this when flying to track my headings, groundspeed etc. and looking at the current gpx files shows 'fixes' that are way off, i will roll back to previous version cause i am keen to support the development and hope this info proves useful. more than happy to submit further info for dev-debugging etc.  cheers

title: Background data issue in latest version?
comment: Chewed through 2gb data in no time. Been using for a while, never had that problem before. Will investigate further.
Have a look at upload settings or custom file names, it can be that frequent file name changes are causing uploads.  If you find any other info please post an issue on github.com/mendhak/gpslogger

title: Nice App
comment: I have tried many and this one is my favorite. I have turned on GPS logging 24/7, so I don't like it's notification bar and the icon are sitting there all the time. Please, add an option to turn off notifications. Thanks!

title: Poor accuracy
comment: Went for a walk at lunch today.  Turned on my phone's GPS and started this GPS Logger app from inside my office building.  Took me about 1 minute to get outside, walked about 20 minutes and then turned it off when I got back inside.  It said I walked over 7 miles for a route I know is much less than 2 miles.  At least this version is better than the previous one, that only logged points if my phone was on and the app was active.  What I think should be changed is that when logging it started it should not start until the GPS gets a lock.  I think it's using the previous location, which it should not do.  And settings should show in their menu item instead of having to select each item to see what the value is.
Finally a stable light weight gps logger

title: Great app
comment: Great app. Simple. Intuitive. Lightweight. Very useful when travelling keeping track

title: Just what I was looking for
comment: Well designed, has the features I want.

title: lightweight with perfect sync
comment: No unneeded features that slow everything down. And you can sync to everything (EVERYTHING!)

title: Good app... Ui need to be improved...

title: Great
comment: Works as advertised. @developer: Would it be possible to zip&encrypt before uploading to gdrive? And could you add SSH upload?

title: Sucks batt like crazy

title: Great app! But URL updates are lost without data connection
comment: The app is great and with full features, and accurate data loggin. Only flaw is : the updates via URL are not tracked in case of communication error, either due to URL site down or data connection not available. WIthout data connection the updates via URL are lost. For other than that, thumb up!
Fixing this very soon, reliable uploads should be out in the next update

comment: In many places, the satellite signal is blanketted - such as in a plane - so don't expect to track your flights, etc..

title: Works well but..
comment: The "start on bootup"  option does nothing.  When I reboot my xiaomi red rice I have to start the logger again manually...

title: Timing issues
comment: It has gmt timing issues while logging. New file is created in new day but it still shows previous date in logs. Say right now its 00:32am here and its logging 19:02 right now
Note that GPX files record in UTC as per the standard; The software that processes the GPX files (Google Earth, Lightroom, Geosetter, etc) will need to convert those to your local time.
Love it
I like

title: Just what I needed
comment: I was looking all around for a GPS app that would easily let me send a location to a URL on my site. GPS Logger made it super simple. One quick click and it worked perfectly the first time! Very nice.

title: Very useful app
comment: It has a lot of functions as such Google Docs integration and ability to post to URL.

title: Used to be a great app
comment: Used to be a good app... dont like the new update, looks like crap, doesn't work as well anymore.

title: Nice
comment: I'm using this app for geo tagging my photos.

title: Needs better support for uploading.
comment: Everything works pretty well, except the auto-upload feature.  Unless you have it turned up crazy high (uploading every minute), you will miss data.  The settings warn against setting the log filename to a frequent interval, but even with the defaults, you will miss 1 hour of stats every day.  If this gets fixed, I'll rate 5 stars, but until then, this app basically doesn't do what it's supposed to.
Fixing this very soon, reliable uploads should be out in the next update

title: Useless without the extensive instructions on the webpage
comment: The app doesn't look very complicated but it is impossible to configure without having studied the instructions on the webpage! The UI and descriptions of options are confusing and everything but helpful :-(

title: Having issues with these logs in Lightroom
comment: The tracker seems to work fine, but when I import them to the Map Module in Lightroom, the tracks are very inaccurate and zig zag all over the map even to areas I didnt come close to driving in.  I dont know if this is a Lightroom issue or the apps problem.  I am emailing the developer to see what he thinks.

title: Displaying points on Google maps
comment: Plz let me know how to displau the points on google maps?

title: Tracking bus fleet easy with this app
comment: I have a fleet of buses to track and having no problems with this app to out position, speed, direction and even battery state... to a web site url with the information in the url.  Set timing to 60 seconds for each post..  Using less than 200mb of data per month to make this happen... which is perfect for the application which costs only $15 per month to save a lot of headaches.
Erster Eindruck: Sehr Gut

title: Very useful. Simple and stable
comment: Every time I hang around without a known plan, I record it. This way I can get back to places I liked.

title: Awesome
comment: This GPS logger is the best I've used. Runs in the background flawlessly, consumes minimal battery and resources, tracks every parameter I can think of, and it's a clean simple interface.  Well Done!
JKKS

title: Good app that could become great with minor changes
comment: This app does exactly what it advertises and I have been very happy with the results.  It took a few tries changing the settings to get the best results and good battery life.  A new feature I would suggest is having the ability to save settings profiles.  For example so I could save settings that would log slower for when I hike verse logging faster for when I am cycling or in a car.  This app works great with photo goetagging applications, recording bike trails, or recording directions.  Thank you for producing a quality product.

title: Very complicated UI, difficult to use
comment: Its hard to know whether the app is logging any points, how many, and how long. I've had several instances where I thought I recorded a track but nothing showed up in the file manager. Why isn't there a blinking green light saying 'recording' and a red 'stop' button?  There are some nice features like Dropbox uploading, but the core of the app is hard to use reliably.

You have to go into the app and press play/start for the logging.  How about making it possible to auto start the logging, not just the app? Also, if the power save is on, GPS gets turned off. It would be nice if the app could reactivate when it turns back on again?

title: Was great, not working with KitKat on N4
comment: Used this for many trails in the past. Will not work when using "device only" location setting with stock KitKat 4.4.2 on Nexus 4. Dev responded to query - unfortunately all other apps (My Tracks, GPS Status, GPS Essentials, Google Maps) all lock on and record position within seconds. Only this app seems unable to get position from GPS.   Pity, as this is unique and useful app.   Edit: v48 still has this problem, no position is generated or logged when using GPS-only for location setting.
Device Only can take up to 12 minutes to generate a location.  See the FAQ page 'more details' for an explanation of GPS/almanacs  Any further issues, please raise on Github

title: Does what it says... Great App!
comment: Stable App and light on battery. However logging stops working when you receive a call. Wish it would stack data in memory when call is on and later push data on network.

comment: Fantastic app.  I upload the file frequently to a custom ftp.  The only option I would love to see in the future is a timoutout / fallback to cell tower option for the GPS.  (So if you walk into a building or something you can set the GPS to give up after a few mins and just report the location based off cell tower location.) Thanks for the awesome app.

comment: Geotagging my photographs was a nightmare as I was doing manually. Now I only have to start this application and upload the gpx file in darktable and all my raw files are geotagged!!

title: Weak and Possible Security Risk
comment: This app wants my email password. I only give that to my email client. Why not just invoke the email client to send email? Not many other features, like keying photos to the log. I recommend "Ski Tracks" app over this. Has many more features, and it works fine for non-skiers! (p.s., Ski Tracks uses the email client so is not a security risk.)

title: Great app, feature heavy
comment: Unlike other similar apps, this focuses on being more 'open'; you're not tied to any services or accounts, instead logging is local and you have a range of options of where to upload and in what format to record data. Dropbox support is a massive plus. GPS naturally uses a lot of power, so I suggest sticking with cell towers if you're in a city, as the precision should be sufficient for most scenarios. Great app overall, aimed at a more technical use case scenario.

title: Good one
comment: Gud one with low battery Usage

title: Perfect
comment: I love this app! Battery life is no issue at all. Even running it all day! Thank you

title: Jerry Swiantkiewicz
comment: I use it to geotag photos with GPicSync on the computer end.  Very accurate.  I tried other geotagging apps and this is by far the most accurate.  Use it on the Galaxy S4 Active.

title: GPS timeout/celltower fallback needs work
comment: When I set "time interval for accuracy" to a value such as 30 seconds, the app doesn't release GPS after 30 seconds. It should fall back to celltower location if there is no GPS fix in 30 seconds, but instead it just keeps looking for GPS indefinitely... drains the battery :(

title: Excellent logger, with excellent facilities for adjusting parameters.
comment: Its power consumption seems really good. I logged on a Nexus 4 every second and 5m for 3.5h and it used about 50% of the battery with WiFi on.  Love the fact it is open source too with no annoying ads.  I hope you can keep it this way.

title: Almost Perfect

The only issue I have with the app is that when it's recording speed it seems to cut the value in half (estimated). I am using output to a text file, and imperial units if that helps.

title: Works well and upload to Dropbox

Only one small drawback nearly no one else might have: Using 2 devices (phone and tablet) on the same Dropbox account and the same Google account I still mass up the files. I would like an option to specify a path per device.

title: A nice little GPS data logger :-)
comment: Very useful for geotagging photos, recording snowboarding runs etc. A few more features which would make is app great: 1) “Auto Send Now” being able to send GPS locations to SMS recipient in case of an emergency (perhaps a separate feature?). 2) An optional red on screen emergency button to trigger the “Auto Send Now” feature (see above). 3) Confirmation to "Stop Logging" as this can be easily pressed by accident. Thanks :-) Additional: GPS Logger does not work on the Sony Xperia X10 Mini Pro :-( Error: The application GPSLogger (process com.mendhak.gpslogger) has stopped unexpectedly. Please try again.

title: Love it!
comment: So many adjustments to save my battery life, plus open source to adapt it to my needs. Awesome!

title: So far so good, needs two more tweaks
comment: I've been hunting for the ideal Backitutde/Latitude replacement. This seems pretty close, there are just two things that I would like to see: 1. Different update frequencies for when plugged in versus battery power. On Backitutde, I had it updating every minute when plugged in and ten minutes on battery; this was a nice balance between accuracy and battery use. When I wanted more frequent updates, I'd plug it into the car charger or portable charger.  2. The ability to upload KMLs once a day. Currently the longest it will wait is eight hours between updates. I would love to see the ability to create a new KML every day at a fixed time (midnight or user-configurable) then upload the previous one at that time, so, for example, my Drive folder has a pile of KMLs that each correspond to a specific date.

title: Can be better :)
comment: Can this app records coordinates by second and on distance in .trl format or NMEA.txt? That way I can track my speed time over the distance.

title: Excellent App
comment: It does the job perfectly. Easy to use and easy to configure. If you can add an option to see the location on a map it would be complete.

title: Quit Saving Lot Files
comment: Program started out well .. but after about 90 days the program just stopped saving the log files.  The program continues to run .. it just doesn't save anything .. which is really the purpose of this program.

title: Easy to use, advanced options
comment: I appreciate the interface for GPS Logger, as it shows only necessary information. You can configure the device with GPX or KML exports, and it can automatically upload traces to public servers. The frequency of recordings, and other features, can be set through the application menu.
Asjalik

title: GPS NICE.

title: Great tool for photograhpers
comment: I use this app to log my location and then import the gpx file to Adobe Lightroom to geotag my images. I have just returned from a three-day backpacking trip where I used the GPSLogger to record my route. By setting the phone to Airplane mode, there was tons of battery life left for the GPS. I have been using this app for over a year now and am really happy with it. It does what I need. The only quibble I have is that I am still trying to find the optimum recording settings for battery life and detailed data.

title: Simple, but no map makes less efficient
comment: Clean, but many steps needed to display on map,... tired! Using offline/cache map will be great!

title: Compact, functional and well thought-out application.
comment: Have exactly the features that you could expect from logging application. Have nice battery-saving features. Great!
Great!

title: Excellent Stream of Information, Problems with Speed on SGS2 (i777)
comment: I've been very happy with this program.  The only big problem I've had is the speed does not display correctly on my Galaxy S2 (i777).  It is low in either unit setting.

title: Great, but logging to file should be default setting
comment: I've used this app for a few years now, it's never steered me wrong. But I recently moved to a new phone, downloaded GPS logger, then went on a 40 mile fatbike trip that I do not want to repeat. Checked GPS logger and I couldn't find my file on the SD card. That's when I noticed the default setting for GPS logger is screen only. I'm sure screen only gets used, but not nearly as much as logging to gpx or kml, so they should be the default settings. No?

title: Exactly what I was looking for, now that Latitude is gone.
comment: This is even better that Google Latitude. Has more options regarding accuracy and frequency. Saves logs locally or on YOUR network locations. I am still using Google+ to see where my family is, but in regards to map my travels and where I was GPS logger for Android is THE BEST.

title: Very Useful!

title: great for 24/7 logging
comment: First app I write review for. This one deserves it though. If you need to continuously log your phone's  position in the background, this is the app. You simply choose time/distance interval, few more options and it logs into file on your SD card. It is just that - simple and efficient logger. I like that it can log simultaniously to more formats (KML, CSV,..) which is great, because you can use KML for google earth and CSV for custom data processing in R for example.

title: Superb
comment: Works perfectly, little battery impact on 3 second sample rate. Widgets make it easybto turn on and off. I use it for geo tagging photos and recording car journeys on Google maps

title: Verry good

title: Excellent for flights
comment: A brilliant application! I like to use this program when I fly, to check out what route my plane flew and how fast and how high, for the sake of curiousity. If you wish to do the same, make sure you turn off Android's location setting for "Use wireless networks" so that the phone will rely purely on the GPS sensor, otherwise logging will stop when you lose telephone signal. :)

title: Cannot use navigation
comment: This app works great, except you cannot use navigation or maps while this is running.  If you try to use nav to find a location while this is running, it will hang at ' searching for gps" and you will not be able to find your destination.  Otherwise, great app.  Except for this one problem.  This one big problem, that makes itself and other functions useless.

title: Excellent & very flexible
comment: This is just the logger app that I've been looking for for a long while. The battery impact on my Nexus 4 seems to be very reasonable (2 second recording with GPS constantly on for about 50 mins seems to use about 9%).  The only feature I would like to see would be the ability to save logging profiles - for example for my use I'd like to set up a high accuracy rapid logging profile for recording cycling and a background low rate low battery use profile for use the rest of the time.

title: Superb
comment: Simply Superb!

title: Better
comment: Getting better. 1 star up to 3.

title: Great!
comment: Perfect. Simple, battery efficient and fine control. Really like the Dropbox integration.

title: Good, light
comment: Very good, no bloat and just all the necessary features. Suggestion: quicker (or configurable) fallback on cell towers when fail to get fix. Thanks for the great app!

title: powerful, lightweight and battery efficient
comment: I'm preparing a nationwide bicycle tour and have been searching for something just like this to map my route while not draining my phone's battery.    I've been testing this for over a week and it's perfect for what I need.  I am ftp'ing the gps files to a server which groups them together by dates (since it breaks the files into date names) to dynamically present the coordinates in a google map)  Thanks!

title: Nice app..
comment: Works as described.. amaze4g.  I use the ftp upload.. with some php to serv up my location on google maps.  However maybe a paid version would be nice with option to run as a service .... appose to cluttering up the interface.

title: Nice app
comment: Tried it out for the first time yesterday while hiking. Very impressed. Would recommend.

title: Awesome
comment: Tons of options to share your log. Thanks!

title: good
comment: very good

title: very good
comment: great job, it would be better if it could directly open the output file on cellphone.

title: That was exactly ...
comment: ... what i was looking for: small, simple, easy to handle and configurable. Logs perfect to gpx, plain and other formats.  Perfect Addition to combine with Lightroom or other Programs.  THUMBS UP !!!

title: Best configurable GPS logger on the market.
comment: Easily configurable and works excellent with my OpenGTS server.

title: Does what it says in the title
comment: And does it well too. Very simple to use with loads of options for formats and where to share/save.

title: Annotation tool
comment: It works on my Galaxy S but with some hickups. In particular the annotation tool doesn't work. It allows me to add a note but then the program crashes. The GPS data is saved but not the notation I made. The auto email works well.

title: Nice one
comment: Its really accurate

title: Reboots my Nexus One
comment: Nice simple logger which should do exactly what I need - unfortunately when I use it; every 30 min or so it reboots my Nexus One running android 2.3.6

title: Pretty slick
comment: I needed an app to keep track of my time for service calls, but this may be easier.we'll try it for a while.

title: Simple and to the point
comment: Very pleased. App works as stated.
Do you need wifi

title: Nice app
comment: Super
easy to use

title: Stops
comment: Doesn't log when tablet sleeps or after it wakes. A500 ICS

title: Awesome
comment: Awesome app. Provides evwrything you need.

title: Ok
comment: In a Day Kong Track, often missed 5mins totally despite bring in clear sight to the sky. Battery Monitor showed no gps activity during that time! Using a Htc One S.

title: Great app, easy to use.
comment: I've tried several apps, but this is nearly perfect for recording a track for photo geotagging.  Works flawlessly on my Droid RAZR, easily going all day (with the battery upgrade) while logging every 10 seconds with 5 meter precision.  The only improvement I've been able to think of is an option to not include data that I don't need in the log to reduce file size, but that's way down the list of desirable features.  Kudos to the designers for this.
Great

title: Outstanding App
comment: This app does exactly what I need: simply create a log of GPS coordinates showing where I have traveled. It does so with a simple, fast interface. Another nice aspect is that I can run this program in the background while running another mapping program in the foreground (like Sygic).

title: Great app
comment: Feature suggestion: Add the ability to acquire location based on wifi essid. Maybe querying wiggle or by using a previous GPS fix when having that wifi in range.

title: Email faulty :-(
comment: All seems to work fine as regards logging data. Email setup appears to work and the test email is received OK. Actual log files fail, nothing in the SMTP log file at the receiving end, debug log says failed to connect .........

title: Gps
comment: Nice gps
G.P.S.

title: good info but email faulty
comment: Samsung S3:   provides gps locations as expected and uploads to google-drive/docs but email appears to only work for the test msgs, not actual logs.  I can workaround the email fault with google-drive but would prefer the email function to actually work (that would make the 5th star).

title: Sync with dropbox doesn't work
comment: Nice app, but doesn't sync well with dropbox, at least on a bad connection. Also doesn't seem to listen for network up to do sync.   Configured to sync every half hour and with min time 300 and distance 60m.a bug?

title: Works well for photograph geotagging
comment: I did a test run today. With my camera set to the exact same time/date as my phone it works great. Accuracy is a little off - up to 10m sometimes - but thats not a huge problem, and is more to do with the GPS inaccuracy. It can automatically upload the track to a number of places, including email and dropbox which is good for simplicty. Using Geosetter, you can easily import the GPX track and syncronise the photos (including RAW) with it.  Just what I needed. :-)

title: This just works
comment: Does what it promises and developer was fast to reply too!

title: Black screen
comment: Sadly my phone crashes (screen stays black no matter what I do after I try to wake it up from standby) with this app running. Desire, Gingerbread.

title: Not working as expected based on settings
comment: I'm using this app on an old phone to track my GPS location while taking photos so I can geotag photos in post without manually finding locations.   However, I tried to set up the app to make a new point every 30 seconds. I expected tons of points, but over the two hour period that I had the tracking on, I ended up with 12 points.   When I'm going to take photos, I need more than that to accurately interpolate location at photo time.

title: It can not creat the GPSlogger file in sd card
comment: gpslogger is the best gps app in my blackberry mobilephone,but i can not use it in my huawei u9500,i think just because it can not creat the GPSlogger file in sd card.

title: Works flawlessly
comment: One thing that would make it more usable for me would be a hyphen (for MySQL) or space (for Excel/Gnumeric) instead of capital T between date and time.  Text files, straight from the app, require some pre-processing for use with these programs.

title: Lightweight and minimalist
comment: You can log a single point or record a track. Then saved it or share or annotate. No additional, saves battery and it works fast. The one GPS logger I most use

title: Works Exactly as Expect
comment: Logs your GPS location to various formats with the push of a button! Plenty of configuration options if needed as well!

title: Acer A500
comment: It fails to work since last update

title: Works a treat
comment: Turn it on, throw phone into my backpack, only GPS data so battery life is great. Awesome app.

title: Broken
comment: Constantly toggled GPS on/off.  Either a really poor attempt at saving battery or it's broken.  Wasn't reporting correct speed.  14 mph when I'm doing 45 and 35 when I was doing 100 mph.  Probably because of ^.

title: Why shut off the gps?
comment: Sure you might save battery if you are logging every minute but for less than that it just has to wait for Gps fix each time.and that is a pain if your phone is not internet connected.

title: Points not very accurate
comment: Tried to track my flight, kept checking on the phone (when it was safe to do so) to make sure it was seeing satellites, and it seemed to be keeping up (google tracks couldn't find anything once I got into the air).  However, once loaded on google earth there were many points that were not accurate at all, especially when the airplane was doing anything other than flying straight and level.  Points were very erratic in position, altitude, and speed.  At a few points the altitude was > 30,000ft, and sometimes faster than 600mph.  I was only flying a single engine propeller plane.  Using the option in google earth to pin the points to the ground to view the ground track showed that the path itself also looked very off.  Again, flying straight and level seemed just fine, but when climbing or descending accuracy went to hell.  Logging frequency was set to 2 seconds, saving as a .gpx format, not using satellite time, and the phone was not in airplane mode.

title: Last version messed up
comment: I use to like this, it was precise and reliable, after the last update it started drifting all over the place,my 5km walk turned out 32km, it's that messed up... so please fix it, whatever went wrong. Thanks

title: Simple, reliable, not limiting!
comment: Great app that does what it says and allows access to the settings, gpx files etc.

title: Very Stable with SSGS II
comment: I use this for Geo-Photos sync and working very well. Thank you very much and look forward for future versions.

title: Perfectly simple
comment: Does exactly what I need it to do, files are great on google maps! Thanks!
A great tool! Very useful. Thanks.
Great on battery life

title: The best!
comment: Now auto sending is the feature!
Does the job

title: Outstanding!
comment: Works well. EGO 4G

title: Great for bike rides
comment: This is a good tool for bike rides. Best used if file automatically emailed to yourself when logging stops, then viewed in google maps. Get route, elevation profile, and speed profile from maps.  Also used it on my job for re-timng traffic signals. Was able to record travel-time date with video by running this app while recording video with on phone.  I have not had any login problems. Occasional gps loss only.

title: Yuk
comment: That says it all.

title: Very Good App
comment: After testing most of the GPS logging type apps available this one proved to be the best in terms of usability and accuracy. Would definitely recommend.

title: Great app
comment: Simplest and best app for generating track files for geotagging photos taken with any camera other than the phone's own camera

title: Time wasting junk
comment: This application has never been that stable. Typically I'd start the logging when I starting riding on a bike trail, and the captured data would be truncated at about the middle point of the ride. Today I used it to log two short hikes and it did not capture any data at all. It didn't upload the data to Google Docs (after the test upload succeeded) and there was no captured .GPX file on the phone. It's pure crap. Don't waste your time. I'm willing to make allowances for applications that have occasional crashes, but this program has been perfectly consistently unreliable.

title: Was good. No need for account info on this app
comment: This app works great. But if you're going to ask me to offer access to my Gmail acct for such a simple app, then you're making a mistake. There's plenty of other ways to upload my track information that give ME control over my info. Too bad guys, dumping you over security concerns

title: Annotate feature not workin
comment: Collecting a single point, annotate does not work.  How do I name a coordinate/point as I collect points?

title: Almost what I need
comment: Cool app for background logging. Works with locked screen.  Would be even better if the saved log could be more precise ( let's say one more decimal in the coordinates ). Now the log seems a bit rough. Therefore 4 stars.
5* app

title: Works great
comment: Small in size, great in performance. Found no bugs so far. Keep the good works!

title: Ok
comment: Could not send coordinates. Everything else worked.

title: Great App!
comment: Doesn't spam or hack email as some idiot suggested (proof please!) You don't HAVE to register any email, Google Docs or Dropbox account to use this app! It can save gpx files locally then share by conventional adroid share function if you're concerned. The app does what it says. Suggest using 'phone' time not 'satellite' time as there is a glitch. If your phone time is accurate so will be your data. Very accurate, but with all gps recording apps you may find some erratic points in resulting log.

title: Great
comment: It is good. But the time is not set correctly..I tried using sat. time or local ph. time but in the log file it is always GMT - 1. It shld be EST instead. How do I fix that?

title: Great app but won't update
comment: This app never failed me but I won't install newer versions because I don't want to give access to my accounts.

title: Are they nuts
comment: After I installed it, it wanted to either: A: For me to give it my password to my email account B: Requested full access to my Google account on a permanent basis.  Who in their right mind would give out this info. Think people, think.  So I don't know if works or not. It's not worth the security risk.

title: Great App
comment: Works well. Would very much like to see some form of auto upload to Dropbox and Google Drive. Or just be able to upload all files at once instead of manually uploading each file.

title: DO NOT USE - ACCOUNTS HACKED
comment: The day after I used this, my the email account used for this app was hacked and sent spam daily to everyone on the list.

title: Great app.
comment: Im sure people would pay for an app this good. Good work dev.

title: Ok ok
comment: Logging frequency is too low..should be configurable like 10 readings a minute or so. Also gps caliberation and lock status should be displayed ..
Effective, with a few problems
Great app, but why does the update want access to my accounts?

title: Simply works

title: Very good

title: Great
comment: Tis
The Best Android Keyboard

title: No need for internet perms.
comment: Uninstalling since developer wants internet access. No need for fancy Google docs... It was good before that. Good bye.

title: Sooper!
comment: A 'no nonsense' app, works great on my HTC desire S. I use it all the time to log a flight track.

title: Good app
comment: Does exactly what I wanted. Multiple email recipients is a very useful feature.

title: Does exactly what it claims
comment: I would really like to be able to get stats on my trips though.

title: Good with minor bug
comment: The application is very useful for personal data logging and would recommend it.  However, I have discovered a bug on Android 2.3, when I select "Prefer cell towers" and leave it logging for a number of days, it prevents other applications from getting a GPS location.

title: Runs well.
comment: No more words needed.
All the features you'd need in a GPS logger

title: Fantastic but needs a few more features
comment: I'd also like to log a single point by pressing the volume button, it could vibrate to confirm it has saved a point. Also to auto upload/sync to drop box would be awesome!

title: THE BEST IN CLASS
comment: Great, Simple, Very Useful.   But please can you add in future update the option to "Log a single point" by pressing the volume controls or to shake the phone while locked with screen off. (with addition of a sound notification)  It will be so convenient in those long backpacking trips, where you don't want to play much with the phone and suck the juice out of it.  And also in bright sunlight no one wants to stare the screen. Plus, most of the outdoors GPS dedicated devices have a button to make a waypoint,(I have one from Garmin, but i don't want to carry extra stuff) Please try to make it happen. You will make many people happy, because there is no other app on the market that simple and useful. Thanks a lot.

title: Simple and solid
comment: Works great on nexus s and galaxy nexus

title: Auto submit
comment: Is it posible to add auto submit to dropbox ?

title: Awesome app
comment: Works flawlessly and great on battery

title: Pappy
comment: Good!!!!

title: GPS doesn't stay on
comment: GPS doesn't seem to stay on all the time making this rather pointless. Galaxy S 2.3.5.

title: Fantastic!
comment: It does both GPX as well as KML and solid, at that. Well worth the, umm, nothing I paid for it ;)

title: Motorola Defy. Runs well
comment: Latest version .18 very stable. If you've had problems before, upgrade. works perfectly

title: Works... Sometimes
comment: Great program, when it works.  Twice now I've gotten back from a hike and hit stop and never got my email, so when I manually browsed through the KML files on there I find there's not one for that trip. Really frustrating when you're banking on having that data, guess I'm not ready to leave my eTrex at home yet. Also refuses to shut down.  When I hit exit the program goes hidden but still shows up as a running task until I reboot the phone.  If they could fix those bugs it would be a great app. It could also really use some sort of offline maps to help you visualize where you are when out on the trail.

title: Doesn't work on my galaxy nexus
comment: Uninstalling

title: Excellent Free GPS Logger
comment: Excellent free GPS logger working on my Atrix. Together Geotag free photo gps tagging software, I can use it anywhere with any computer to geotag my photos and upload to Piecasa or Panoramio. If can add Google map view to see the track will be perfect..............I have some problem to connect to OpenStreetMap, don't know how to resolve.

title: 5 star but one problem
comment: I'm giving it 5 stars because aplication is doing what is supposed to do. My problem is that when I press home and lock device, gpslogger stops responding. Sometimes it continue to log, sometimes it just stops. When I try to open it again it just stops respondig (option to wait, force close or report). Please can you fix that? Huawei U8650, Cyanogenmod 7.1.0

title: Gps without gps
comment: Good app. Wow gave the exact gps coordinates without using any data or gps.

title: Argh!!
comment: Wish it recorded to file by default instead of "logging to screen". Missed a very important logging exercise because of this. Otherwise, works well..
Couldn't ever get a GPS lock. HTC Sensation

title: Does what it says on the tin.
comment: It logs perfectly on my HTC desire. Doesn't miss a point, hardly touches the battery and allows me to tag my images on the pc with geosetter.

title: Excellent utility
comment: Worked great on my last 8-hour hike, barely denting the battery on my ZTE Blade (which was in Airplane mode, there being no mobile signal where I was in any event.) Had it set for 3-minute updates, it missed a few but that's probably due to me being hidden by mountains/rocks. Very handy utility - thanks and kudos to Mendhak.
I see many people had problems but I don't want to discourige others. This app worked great on my Xperia X10 mini pro. Great battery saver!
Description would be perfect life-logging app. Stored only 6 (irrelevant) points in 3 days & crashed 2x the phone :-(

comment: Could not get any positions on my HTC desire.

title: Great!
comment: Love it!  EvO 4G -Myn's Warm Two Point Two
Good try track my ride free
Hangs and crashes. Otherwise - would be nice app. Uninstalling.
Great app. Does what a 50$ GPS Logger device does. You can adjust the logging interval from "logging details" menu.

title: Terrible..

title: Droid X Crash
comment: Perfect idea for a program but I can't even open it up any more before force close.

title: Buggy

Stopped working, every startup is a gotcr close. Samsung Galaxy Mini

title: Auto Mail issues
comment: This sort of works. Appears to only work when it has a fix. Also emails the KML file. Would be so much more useful if it just emailed the coords, or have an option to do so. Apart from that - love this app. It does everything I need - almost :-) Sort out the mail and 5 stars!
been using for 4mnths/10,000 km of travels. Does everything exactly like I wanted/expected:logs everything automatically using predefine settings.thx!

title: New gpx file for each day, would be awsome !!!
comment: I used a Garmin Legend to geotag photos before I found this promising app. First I was very happy because gpx files are named according to the date (yyyymmdd.gpx) excatly like on Garmin gps. However instead of creating a new gpx file for each day, it keeps writing to the same file for several days (unless it is turned off) Thats a pitty.
Fails to run on my Desire S...
This was the best gps logging app until recent updates. Now it just crashes after logging for a while. Don't buy. Galaxy S.
Was really good but after last few updates it always hangs after a few minutes use. HTC desire
Now Optionfull!! Maybe an autotrace cleanup still needed

title: Unreliable, fix desperately needed.
comment: Unreliable logging needs fixing. Otherwise this app does exactly what I need efficiently. HTC Desire and Samsung Galaxy S II.
When disabling logging I get the FC/Wait/Report popup. FC and it remains in the notification bar. Evo 2.3.4 CM7
Fantasic App! Please make the recent "No Provider=>No Logging" feature an Option. I frequently use the app to "keep a GPS lock" for faster locating.
I ran this during a three day backpacking trip with all other services off. With logging set to every 300 seconds it used less than 20% battery.

title: Unreliable
comment: When I have upload a track I often it had stopped recording half way through, even though it appeared to be recording okay. Not usable with this bug.

title: Motorola Spice blank <coordinates/>

It said not responding asking me to wait or force quit after I changed apps on my Defy. Same problem others reporting. Switching to another logger now
Great idea. Too bad it's unreliable. HTC Desire S

Only logs for a while, then seems to switch off on my Samsung epic 4g Froyo 2.2
Force close on launch since I entered Gmail details. Will retry after update ...

comment: On a Motorola Droid there seems to be some bug where certain settings cause it to crash. When it crashes, it can't even be force-stopped. I have to delete all data related to the app and then restart it again, resetting my settings. I suspect an issue with file permissions. Bug always occurs when hitting start/stop. Price of the paid version is quite fair.
Awesome app, used for EMC survey for USAF when Garmin wouldn't log to computer.
Super!

Does exactly as described, even recording track points. Lasted 9 hours on my old htc Hero, in 45 temps and rain on mtb. s

interval works really bad, need cpu wakelock otherwise 60seconds could become 30minutes wich makes app useless (nexus one)
Sux - used this to log a long bicycle ride - but when the day was done only the first 30 min. was logged :(
Nice.Should be great if it can first rely on cell gps for speed and inside buildings,then (if available) to true gps. Now, its gps OR celltowers gps.
Needs to run as service so that it doesn't get killed.
Great little app. Does exactly what it is supposed to do. Clean interface, easy to set up, what more could you want...
Only logs per minute? Why?
So good! Record cycling routes to gpx files, import them into Google Maps, post links to club website. Perfect.
Absolutely perfect, just what i was looking for to geotag photos
Excellent app and runs in the background without any hassle. Does not hammer the battery like some logging apps do. Recommended
It works but it would be great to have options for timing. Once per minute isn't enough for driving.
Excellent tool. A bit hungry on battery (draws from 100% to 0 in 6 hours of 5-second logging).
Trying to make my phone a car logger, need autostart/auto-on options & better recovery so it starts up again, maybe a service option? Very nice app!
Great work, thanks! From desire
Exactly what I needed.
Thank you mendhak. Works on my HTC Desire. Logged to both KML andGPX. Imported the KML file into Google maps. Recommend.
Exactly what I was looking for! Superb app.
Works well.

Very good and useful.
Would be nice if it automatically turned GPS on/off at set intervals
Great app, works beautifully with trailrunner. Only complaint i have is that if it stops getting gps signal theres no audible alert.
This background GPS recording is perfect! I can return home from unkown point like jangle by back tracking used offline map with this logs.
Worked great on recent Iceland trip, few occasions when it had stopped recording and needed a restart which was annoying
Very nice application. Simple to use and worked flawlessly x x x
Very nice app. Simple and easy to use interface.
No frills, no fuss no useless bloated complex functionalities to boggle the mind. Perfect in its simplicity. kudos to the developer!
Cant beat MyTracks. Nice but too basic for me.
5 stars for idea and program. Need to make avail. Ablity to change from meters to feet in settings. Email dev. Timely response. will be fixing.
Simple and light weight. Active developer too! Thanks!
Use with GPicSync to geotag photos- ace.
Great application but when I load my kml file in gearth it only comes up as a point instead of a route.

Luv this app. Work in conservation and is handy as heck. Thanks to all the dev.
Works great, nice and simple!
Great app! Works exactly as described.
